item.title: About
item.description: DataScribe is a project of the Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media at George Mason University. Staff Funders DataScribe has been made possible in part by a major grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities: Exploring the human endeavor. Any views, findings, conclusions, or recommendations expressed in this Web resource do not necessarily represent those of the National Endowment for the Humanities

item.title: Get Started
item.description: In order to start working with DataScribe, you will need: to have a plan for how you want to sort your content into datasets; to have a plan for how you want to build the forms for your data and datasets; to add your historical data sources into Omeka as as items and item sets. Thinking about data Things you need to decide: How many forms do you want to build?
